subject: p15881535
History: -year-old man with cough for 4 weeks. Evaluate for pneumonia.
Findings: Normal cardiomediastinal and hilar contours. Lungs are mildly hyperinflated and clear. There has been interval resolution of the opacity in the right cardiophrenic sulcus. Pleural surfaces are normal. Right clavicular hardware appears intact. There is severe anterior osteophytosis of the thoracic spine.
